intro: Zaluzianskya gracilis, commonly known as the slender zonal plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and as a houseplant.
